name: Oleander
Relationship: Antidotes: CAMPH.; SULPH.Compare: CON.; NAT-M.; RHUS; CAUST.; LATHYR. Oleander contains Oleandrin and also Nerein which latter is said to be closely related if not identical with Digitalin. The pulse becomes slower, more regular, more powerful. DIURESIS; palpitation, oedema and dyspnoea of valvular disease, disappear.

Eyes: Can see objects only when looking at them sideways
SENSATION AS IF EYES WERE DRAWN BACK INTO THE HEAD
Stomach: CANINE HUNGER, WITH HURRIED EATING, without appetite
Head: Occiput, with red, rough, herpetic spots in front
Numb feeling
ERUPTION ON SCALP
Dull, unable to think
Vertigo and diplopia, when looking down
Pain in brain, as if head would burst
Vertigo, when looking fixedly at an object, and on rising in bed
Indolence
Humid, fetid spots BEHIND EARS
CORROSIVE ITCHING ON FOREHEAD AND EDGE OF HAIR; worse, heat
Chest: PALPITATION, with weakness and empty feeling in chest
Oppression as from a weight; asthmatic when lying down
Face: Pale, sunken, with blue rings around eyes
Skin: VERY SENSITIVE SKIN; slightest friction causes soreness and chapping
VIOLENT ITCHING ERUPTION, BLEEDING, OOZING; want of perspiration
Pruritus, especially of scalp, which is sensitive
Itching, scurfy pimples; herpes; sensitive and numb
Extremities: Want of animal heat in limbs

details: Has a marked action on the skin, heart and nervous system, producing and curing paralytic conditions with cramp-like contractions of upper extremities. Hemiplegia. Difficult articulation.
